News.Title: Affle3i Limited Grants 84,212 Stock Options to Employees Under ESOP Scheme
News.Summary: Affle3i Limited (formerly Affle India Limited) granted 84,212 stock options to eligible employees under its Employee Stock Option Scheme-2021. The options cover 84,212 equity shares with a face value of Rs. 2 each. The exercise price will be based on the closing market price on the National Stock Exchange on November 11, 2025. The options will vest in four equal tranches of 25% each at 12, 24, 36, and 48 months from the grant date of November 12, 2025. Employees will have one year from the vesting date to exercise their options. The scheme complies with SEBI regulations for share-based employee benefits.

News.Title: Affle Reports 19.1% Revenue Growth to INR 6,467 Million in Q2 with Strong Margin Expansion
News.Summary: Affle3i Limited delivered revenue of INR 6,467 million in the second quarter, marking a 19.1% year-over-year growth. The company achieved EBITDA of INR 1,461 million with 28.9% growth and 172 basis points margin expansion. PAT reached INR 1,105 million, growing 20.1% year-over-year. The CPCU business drove 109 million conversions at INR 58.0 per conversion, generating revenue of INR 6,319 million. India and Global Emerging Markets contributed 73.9% to revenue with 20.0% growth, while Developed Markets grew 16.8% contributing 26.1%. The company launched Niko, an AI agenti capability for iOS ecosystem automation. Management noted impact from Real Money Gaming issues in India but expects this to be offset by early festive season demand. The company was granted two new US patents, expanding its IP portfolio to 16 patents. Sequential margin expansion continued for the sixth consecutive quarter.

News.Title: Affle 3i Limited Reports No Material Deviation in Rs 737.43 Crore Preferential Issue Fund Utilization
News.Summary: Affle 3i Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, regarding the utilization of proceeds from its preferential issue. ICRA Limited, the monitoring agency, reported no material deviation from the stated objects of the issue. The company raised Rs 749.02 crore through the issuance of 69 lakh equity shares at Rs 1,085.54 per share. Net proceeds were revised to Rs 737.43 crore due to higher issue-related expenses. During the quarter, the company utilized Rs 238.32 crore across various objectives: Rs 37.58 crore for technology development, Rs 75 crore for repaying subsidiary liabilities, and Rs 125.74 crore for general corporate purposes including working capital requirements and loan repayment. Unutilized funds of Rs 499.11 crore are deployed in fixed deposits and mutual funds across various banks. All projects remain on schedule with completion targeted for March 2027.

News.Title: Affle3i Limited Reports Strong Q2 Growth with Revenue Rising 25% to ₹6,467 Crores
News.Summary: Affle3i Limited announced its quarterly results for the second quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue from operations of ₹6,467.18 million, compared to ₹6,207.40 million in the previous quarter. For the half-year period, consolidated revenue reached ₹12,674.58 million versus ₹10,623.85 million in the same period last year. Consolidated profit after tax for the quarter was ₹1,105.01 million, with half-year profit at ₹2,160.13 million compared to ₹1,748.81 million in the previous year. On a standalone basis, the company posted quarterly revenue of ₹2,198.30 million and profit after tax of ₹300.06 million. The Board of Directors approved these unaudited financial results in their meeting held on November 1, 2025. The company's earnings per share for the quarter stood at ₹7.87 on a consolidated basis and ₹2.14 on a standalone basis.

News.Title: Affle 3i Limited Allots 37,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Scheme
News.Summary: Affle 3i Limited has allotted 37,000 equity shares with a face value of Rs. 2 each to Affle (India) Limited Employees' Welfare Trust under the Employee Stock Option Scheme 2021. News.Title: Affle 3i Receives 16th US Patent for AI-Based Fraud Detection Technology

News.Title: Affle 3i Reports Record Q1 Results with 19.5% Revenue Growth and 239 bps EBITDA Margin Expansion
News.Summary: Affle 3i Limited delivered its highest-ever quarterly performance with revenue of INR 6,207 million, representing 19.5% year-over-year growth. The company achieved record EBITDA of INR 1,397 million with 33.7% growth and 239 basis points margin expansion to 22.5%. PAT reached INR 1,055 million, up 21.8% year-over-year. The CPCU business drove 107 million conversions at INR 58.0 per conversion, generating CPCU revenue of INR 6,200 million. India & Global Emerging Markets contributed 72.3% of revenue with 18.1% growth, while Developed Markets grew 23.3% and contributed 27.7%. The company integrated Opticks AI into its consumer platform stack and became an Apple-certified partner. Management targets 20% organic revenue growth for FY2026 and medium-term EBITDA margin goal of 23%. The company maintains its 10X decadal growth vision through organic expansion and selective acquisitions.

News.Title: Affle Receives 15th US Patent for User Visibility Count Encoding Technology
News.Summary: Affle has been granted a US patent for a method to encode user visibility count, which tracks advertisement exposure frequency while reducing memory and computing requirements. The technology uses probabilistic encoding and algorithmic hashing functions to estimate advertisement exposure across connected devices, particularly effective for Connected TV where direct user interaction is limited. It also supports digital ecosystems including IoT, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality. The innovation enhances targeting accuracy, campaign performance and the company's CPCU model by enabling precise evaluation of user awareness and optimizing media spending. This represents Affle's 15th granted patent, adding to a portfolio of 36 unique patent applications. The patent was invented by eight team members including Anuj Khanna Sohum, Charles Yong, and others.

News.Title: Affle (India) Reports Strong Q1 Growth with Net Profit Rising 21% to 1.05 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Affle (India) delivered robust quarterly results with consolidated net profit increasing to 1.05 billion rupees from 866 million rupees year-over-year. Revenue grew to 6.2 billion rupees compared to 5.19 billion rupees in the same period last year. EBITDA rose to 1.4 billion rupees from 1.04 billion rupees year-over-year. The company's margin improved to 22.51% from 20.12% in the previous year period, indicating enhanced operational efficiency.

News.Title: Affle 3i Limited Reports Strong Q1 FY2026 Results with 19.5% Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Affle 3i Limited announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue from operations of ₹6,207.40 million, up from ₹5,195.03 million in the same quarter last year, representing a 19.5% year-over-year growth. Consolidated profit after tax increased to ₹1,055.00 million compared to ₹865.90 million in Q1 FY2025, marking a 21.8% growth. On a standalone basis, revenue from operations grew to ₹1,989.56 million from ₹1,631.46 million year-over-year, while standalone profit after tax reached ₹297.00 million versus ₹281.68 million in the previous year. The company's earnings per share on a consolidated basis improved to ₹7.52 from ₹6.18 in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The board meeting was held on July 26, 2025, and the results were reviewed by Walker Chandiok & Co LLP.

News.Title: Affle 3i Limited's VP Global Strategic Partnerships Vishal Soni Steps Down from Senior Management Role

News.Summary: The Indian government has proposed to eliminate the 6% equalisation levy on online advertising, effective from April 1st. This change is included in the Finance Bill and will directly impact companies like Affle (India) that operate in the digital advertising space.

News.Title: Affle India Granted New Patent for Advertisement Fraud Detection System
